alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clay, Randolph, Quitman and northwestern Terrell Counties through 615 PM EST... At 529 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lumpkin to 8 miles west of Cuthbert. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Shellman, Parrott, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Crossroads, Chambliss, Hatcher, Morris, Benevolence, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Wades, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Pachitla, Peterson Hill, Coles and White House. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
